questions.question: The turning Point in Victor's battle with his conscience came when he...

choices.answer: forgave his mother for dying when he was young
told his story of the creation to the authorities
admitted he was guilty of killing William and Justine
decided not to create a companion for the monster

questions.question: Where did the monster reside so he could watch over Victor?

choices.answer: In the mountains near Geneva, Switzerland
in the icy confines of the North Pole
on the slopes of the Italian Alps
in the forested regions of Transylvania

questions.question: What human shortcoming is emphasized by everyone's reaction to the monster?

choices.answer: excessive reference to oneself
resentment for the success of another person
overemphasis on the importance of physical beauty
denial of the sincerity of other people motives

questions.question: What did Victor gain through Clerval?

choices.answer: A feeling for musical compositions
an appreciation for languages
an understanding of social classes
a knowledge of the world geography

questions.question: Victor's purpose in telling Robert Walton his story was to...

choices.answer: prevent others from making the same mistake
warn the world about his hideous creation
confess his sins before he died
convince Walton to take up his cause

questions.question: The story was relayed to the reader by Robert Walton, who was...

choices.answer: Elizabeths's father
the monster's creator
a ship's captain
a Russian villager

questions.question: The monster compared himself to Satan, but knew he was worse since even Satan...

choices.answer: was handsome
was loved by his creator
could control his rage
had friends

questions.question: What did Victor mistakenly believe the monster planned to do on Victor's wedding night?

choices.answer: see the goodness in life
abandon his pursuit of Victor
battle Victor to the death
lure Elizabeth into a trap

questions.question: The monster eventually concluded that the cottagers were sad because they...

choices.answer: had no friends
missed their mother
lived in poverty
were ill and faced death

questions.question: By the messages he left Victor, we can see that the monster was trying to...

choices.answer: convince Victor to give up the fight and create a companion
anger Victor so he would continue to pursue him
show Victor the error of his ways
lull Victor into a false sense of security

questions.question: Victor changed his mind about creating a companion for the monster when he envisioned...

choices.answer: it to be as evil as the monster
Elizabeth's response to it
how difficult it would be to duplicate his work
the extensive time it would require

questions.question: Both Elizabeth and Victor's father speculated that Victor's melancholy was caused by his...

choices.answer: feelings of being confined to Europe
love for another woman
inability to succeed at science
feelings of abandonment

questions.question: Victor received a cold and rude welcome in Ireland because the people thought he...

choices.answer: brought bad omens to their homeland
was a representative of the English government
meant to attack them
had killed the man they found along the road

questions.question: Victor unsuccessfully tried to persuade Walton's crew to continue on by...

choices.answer: rousing their spirits
condemning them as failures
appealing to their pride
bribing them with money

questions.question: The monster declared everlasting war on all mankind and especially Victor after...

choices.answer: the cottagers rejected him
he was accused of killing William
Victor abandoned him in Inglostadt
Elizabeth refused to look at him

questions.question: Why did the monster say to Victor, "I am satisfied, miserable wretch"?

choices.answer: Victor agreed to create a companion for the monster
the monster had managed to kill Victor's soul
The monster had killed all the people Victor loved
Victor vowed he would live to pursue the monster

questions.question: The monster's feelings of rage and injustice surfaced when...

choices.answer: the cottagers suddenly stopped leaving food for him
Safie and Felix were married and bore a child
Victor would not agree to listen to his story
he was shot after saving a girl from drowning

questions.question: What lesson might the reader learn from Victor's experience?

choices.answer: Good always triumphs over evil
One always needs to be true tp one's friends
Actions have consequences
Science involves taking risks

questions.question: Felix's demeanor brightened upon...

choices.answer: the arrival of the new crops
the death of his father
Agatha's departure from the cottage
Safie's arrival at the cottage

questions.question: Why did Elizabeth feel responsible for William's death

choices.answer: she gave him the necklace
she let him play alone
she failed to warn him about strangers
she allowed Justine to be in charge of William
